reviews.sentence: Good but had bad experience. Checked in as Platinum guest to front desk being a little combative about my request for an upgrade. The person stated I had free wifi as my upgrade and could use the lounge. That is already included in my room so not sure how that was an upgrade. After back and forth the desk clerk agrees to move me to a room on the concierge level. I get to my room to find out that the executive tower where my original room and the upgraded room are located has not had hot water and will not have hot water for days. I ask why they did not put me in the other tower when they knew my room would not have hot water. No answer but they did move me to the other tower on the second day. I think every guest should have been told that there was no hot water but especially since I stay a lot at Mariot hotels you think they would want to to inform me as well. Overall the location worked for business travel to avoid some of the city center traffic. The lounge was big and well attended well stocked with breakfast and evening food and drinks. However I was interrogated several times about why I was in the lounge. I gladly gave them my room number and name but was still asked repeatedly if I really had access It seemed a bit rude. So the hotel is a good one but I had some bad interactions there. I would probably choose it again for its location for my work.

Very good. check in formalities was time taking.

It is the old hotel but character and staff worth it. The JW Mariot in West Bay is becoming too expensive. This hotel at the east end of the corniche it ideal for accessing some locations in Doha. I found that recently getting to the north of westbay eg Lusail only took 30 minutes hence this hotel was not far out of the way. Staff friendly executive tower has character and is fine executive lounge intimate. I noted and appreciated the recent improvements to the AV on the cardio machine in the fitness centre.
Very nice comfortable hotel in a suitable location. Outside setting areas were amazing and very socila. Requested rooms were nor ready on arrival.

Need urgently renovation. Hotel in general need renovation but especially rooms are in very poor shape. During my 5 days staying I called the maintenance 3 times. Room keeping not good as they did not change the bed sheet every day Internet expensive breakfast buffet everyday the same treadmill machines in the gym are not suitable for tall guys as the built in TV screen not adjustable. But they have a good steak house.

Unusual Policy. Currently staying at this hotel with my husband and 18 month old daughter. Upon arrival we found that there was no baby cot in the room even though I had requested a day before our arrival. I called reception and they rectified this nice and quickly. Fantastic response time. However once the cot was set up they had only left a bottom sheet and a rather large adult pillow. I spoke to reception and requested a blanket When they came up they brought only another bottom sheet. When I clarified that I wanted a blanket I was told that they can not supply us with one due to safety as babies can not have a blanket. So we now have no blanket for our baby to sleep with. I find their response odd when blankets are perfectly safe for babies and yet they left in the cot a large pillow which I immediately removed which could quite easily suffocate a childAside from this the hotel so far has been nice and staff very helpful. I would stay here again but would be sure to bring my own baby bedingI have never had this issue before and have stayed in almost a dozen hotels with my little one.

hotel near the airport. i always like to visit this hotel if i m in hurry or my trip is so fast like one day only coz its next to air port and easy to reach airport i love the pool and the view from my room to see the Cornish from my room with beach viewalso one of the amazing things its on Friday the buffet full of all kind of sweet yumi yumione thing i want them to add in hotel bathroom. they know what i mean coz we arab if we visit some place we do not like to have idont know how to say it in English but the thing we use to wash شطاف. so i hope the wl change that they have already now.

Dining Experience at Doha Mariot Restaurant Gallery. My colleagues and I were hunting for a nice place to have pre christmas dinner. One of them suggested this place. Naturally as this is a hotel setting the venue looks classy. It was a night of street food theme when we visited Doha Mariot Restaurant Gallery. Not quite sure if that changes every week or it was a constant theme there. Anyhow we proceeded into the area and we were greeted by a lot of tables along the hallway which pretty much resemble that of street food ambience only with a sophisticated air to it. We dined in at Asia Live and the staff were all accommodating. On the food option you have got quite a number to choose from Mexican dishes to japanese and indian delicacies. I tried both mexican and japanese and a bit of indian food. While there at Asia Live we were told that the buffet comes with alcohol beer wine. So naturally we ordered some. When the bill came out it was sort of a separate charging. It may have meant that we can opt not to order those because apparently the buffet itself had a separate bill liner. Anyway for those who d like to try buffet but on budgetary constraints this is not your place to go to. It kind of blew me off when we saw the tab. it is pricey compared to other hotels offering buffet style meals under QR20. Yes the staff are good and so is the ambience but essentially you had go there for the food more than anything else. And that is where I think we are a bit short changed. And as the theme was street food there really was not much to look forward to other than finger foods or food on stick. Perhaps if they will bring the price lower and offer more sumptuous dishes then I guess we could try again. Until then we will just check out other hotels and their buffet dishes at a lesser price range.

Not so bad stay. This was our second time in mariot. Which means that we like it here especially me. The pool side restaurant and the asian bar. Is it understood that security guards are just doing their job. But it is very unprofessional to judge a person. my fiancee based only on the jeans she wear ripped stylewhich ur staff thought that she was a prostitute and worst is in the your system and ur staff claimed that we have 4 boys in our room which is proven wrong. We left the hotel and left a pls make up my room tag on the door knob but wen we came back. it was not clean. I ve waited exceeding the check in time.
Hotel Staffs are very attentive courteous efficient friendly and very polite. Everything is so clean and comfotable. Foods are delicious appealing satisfying excellent and so yummy �.

Old but great hotel. The hotel can be a bit dated in some of the furnishing but it is very comfortable with great service. The pool is fantastic. The executive lounge on the executive side is a great feature. The location is close to the airport and has a great view of the Doha skyline.
Very classy. I like the cozy atmosphere and they treated their guests very well. Thank you for the complimentary sweets.

Good and bad at this Mariot. I am a longtime Mariot customer and was given Concierge access. The Concierge lounge staff was excellent. Food and drinks were very good most days. I give it a 5. Front desk is pretty decent although I never got my Mariot points 30 days applied to my account. Big negative. Selections of restaurants is good. Parties outside DJs can be very loud and keep guests awake.
The room is large and it is view is cool and comfortable. swimming pool is very good large 2partitions.
Easy to access from Airport and located within walking distance from Souks shopping districts and amenities. Great choice of food in restaurant and would return again and service was superb.

Layover. Stayed for 5 hours during Doha layover at this Mariot. Was not so close to airport but papas close as any other. Beautiful facility and great staff. The room was excellent. Highly recommend. They brought a crib cot for baby and made us very comfortable with adjacent rooms. The beds are quite up to standard or above. We had an excellent rest before proceeding on our journey to Sri Lanka.
Close to the Airport lovely location. Close the airport and lovely customer service.

Good location and good service. The hotel is located close to the airport. The hotel is a little run down. The staff were extremely helpful. It was a short stay as I had an earlier departure. Canot comment on the breakfast since I did not have the breakfast.
Perfect location close to Hotel and walkable to The Cornice and Modern Art Museum.
